text: ਸੋ ਛੂਟੈ ਮਹਾ ਜਾਲ ਤੇ ਜਿਸੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਨਿਰੰਤਰਿ ॥੨॥

translation.text: They escape from the great noose of death; they are permeated with the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||2||

transliteration.text: sō shūtai mahā jāl tē jis gur sabad nirantar .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਕਿਆ ਕਹਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਸਤ ਸਰੁ ॥

translation.text: How can I chant the Glorious Praises of the Guru? The Guru is the ocean of Truth and clear understanding.

transliteration.text: gur kī mahimā kiā kahā gur bibēk sat sar .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਓਹੁ ਆਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦੀ ਜੁਗਹ ਜੁਗੁ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ॥੩॥

translation.text: He is the Perfect Transcendent Lord, from the very beginning, and throughout the ages. ||3||

transliteration.text: ōh ād jugādī jugah jug pūrā paramēsar .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਵਹੁ ਸਦ ਸਦਾ ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਮਨੁ ਰੰਗੇ ॥

translation.text: Meditating on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, forever and ever, my mind is filled with the Love of the Lord, Har, Har.

transliteration.text: nām dhiāvah sad sadā har har man rangē .

text: ਜੀਉ ਪ੍ਰਾਣ ਧਨੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਹੈ ਨਾਨਕ ਕੈ ਸੰਗੇ ॥੪॥੨॥੧੦੪॥

translation.text: The Guru is my soul, my breath of life, and wealth; O Nanak, He is with me forever. ||4||2||104||

transliteration.text: jīu prān dhan gurū hai nānak kai sangē .4.2.104.

translation.text: Aasaa, Fifth Mehl:

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 5 .

text: ਸਾਈ ਅਲਖੁ ਅਪਾਰੁ ਭੋਰੀ ਮਨਿ ਵਸੈ ॥

translation.text: If the Invisible and Infinite Lord dwells within my mind, even for a moment,

transliteration.text: sāī alakh apār bhōrī man vasai .

translation.text: then all my pains, troubles, and diseases vanish. ||1||

transliteration.text: dūkh darad rōg māi maidā habh nasai .1.

text: ਹਉ ਵੰਞਾ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੁ ਸਾਈ ਆਪਣੇ ॥

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to my Lord Master.

transliteration.text: hau vanñā kurabān sāī āpanē .

text: ਹੋਵੈ ਅਨਦੁ ਘਣਾ ਮਨਿ ਤਨਿ ਜਾਪਣੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Meditating on Him, a great joy wells up within my mind and body. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: hōvai anad ghanā man tan jāpanē .1. rahāu .

text: ਬਿੰਦਕ ਗਾਲ੍ਹਿ ਸੁਣੀ ਸਚੇ ਤਿਸੁ ਧਣੀ ॥

translation.text: I have heard only a little bit of news about the True Lord Master.

text: ਸੂਖੀ ਹੂੰ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇ ਮਾਇ ਨ ਕੀਮ ਗਣੀ ॥੨॥

translation.text: I have obtained the peace of all peace, O my mother; I cannot estimate its worth. ||2||

transliteration.text: sūkhī hūn sukh pāi māi n kīm ganī .2.

text: ਨੈਣ ਪਸੰਦੋ ਸੋਇ ਪੇਖਿ ਮੁਸਤਾਕ ਭਈ ॥

translation.text: He is so beautiful to my eyes; beholding Him, I have been bewitched.

transliteration.text: nain pasandō sōi pēkh musatāk bhaī .

text: ਮੈ ਨਿਰਗੁਣਿ ਮੇਰੀ ਮਾਇ ਆਪਿ ਲੜਿ ਲਾਇ ਲਈ ॥੩॥

translation.text: I am worthless, O my mother; He Himself has attached me to the hem of His robe. ||3||

text: ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਹਭਾ ਹੂੰ ਬਾਹਰਾ ॥

translation.text: He is beyond the world of the Vedas, the Koran and the Bible.

text: ਲਾਖ ਭਗਤ ਆਰਾਧਹਿ ਜਪਤੇ ਪੀਉ ਪੀਉ ॥

text: ਤੂੰ ਸਭਨਾ ਕੇ ਨਾਥ ਤੇਰੀ ਸ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਸਭ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

text: ਸਦਾ ਸਹਾਈ ਸੰਤ ਪੇਖਹਿ ਸਦਾ ਹਜੂਰਿ ॥

translation.text: You are the constant help and support of the Saints, who behold You Ever-present.

text: ਨਾਮ ਬਿਹੂਨੜਿਆ ਸੇ ਮਰਨ੍ਹਿ ਵਿਸੂਰਿ ਵਿਸੂਰਿ ॥੨॥

text: ਦਾਸ ਦਾਸਤਣ ਭਾਇ ਮਿਟਿਆ ਤਿਨਾ ਗਉਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Those servants, who lovingly perform the Lord's service, are freed from the cycle of reincarnation.

transliteration.text: dās dāsatan bhāi mitiā tinā gaun .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਵਿਸਰਿਆ ਜਿਨ੍ਹਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਤਿਨਾੜਾ ਹਾਲੁ ਕਉਣੁ ॥੩॥

translation.text: What shall be the fate of those who forget the Naam? ||3||

transliteration.text: visariā jinhā nām tinārā hāl kaun .3.

text: ਜੈਸੇ ਪਸੁ ਹਰ੍ਹਿਆਉ ਤੈਸਾ ਸੰਸਾਰੁ ਸਭ ॥

translation.text: As are the cattle which have strayed, so is the entire world.

transliteration.text: jaisē pas harhiāu taisā sansār sabh .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਬੰਧਨ ਕਾਟਿ ਮਿਲਾਵਹੁ ਆਪਿ ਪ੍ਰਭ ॥੪॥੪॥੧੦੬॥

translation.text: O God, please cut away Nanak's bonds, and unite him with Yourself. ||4||4||106||

text: ਆਸਾ ਮਹਲਾ ੫ ॥

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 5 .

text: ਹਭੇ ਥੋਕ ਵਿਸਾਰਿ ਹਿਕੋ ਖਿਆਲੁ ਕਰਿ ॥

translation.text: Lay aside your false pride, and dedicate your mind and body to Him. ||1||

transliteration.text: jhūthā lāh gumān man tan arap dhar .1.

text: ਆਠ ਪਹਰ ਸਾਲਾਹਿ ਸਿਰਜਨਹਾਰ ਤੂੰ ॥

text: ਜੀਵਾਂ ਤੇਰੀ ਦਾਤਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਕਰਹੁ ਮੂੰ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: I live by Your bountiful gifts - please, shower me with Your Mercy! ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jīvānh tērī dāt kirapā karah mūn .1. rahāu .

text: ਸੋਈ ਕੰਮੁ ਕਮਾਇ ਜਿਤੁ ਮੁਖੁ ਉਜਲਾ ॥

translation.text: So, do that work, by which your face shall be made radiant.

translation.text: Enshrine the One Lord within your consciousness; He shall never die. ||3||

text: ਤਿਨ੍ਹਾ ਪਿਆਰਾ ਰਾਮੁ ਜੋ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਭਾਣਿਆ ॥

text: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦਿ ਅਕਥੁ ਨਾਨਕਿ ਵਖਾਣਿਆ ॥੪॥੫॥੧੦੭॥

text: ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਜਨ ਪਰਸਾਦਿ ਦੁਖੁ ਸਭੁ ਮੇਟਿਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
